amendments.title: Of a perfecting nature.
amendments.latest_major_action: Amendment SA 255 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 66 - 33. Record Vote Number: 61.

amendments.title: An amendment numbered 5 printed in Part B of House Report 114-2 to express a sense of Congress that the Administration should stop putting the interest of immigrants who worked within the legal framework to come to the US behind those who came here illegally.
amendments.latest_major_action: On agreeing to the Schock amendment (A005) Agreed to by recorded vote: 260 - 167 (Roll no. 33).

amendments.title: An amendment numbered 4 printed in Part B of House Report 114-2 to express a sense of Congress that the Executive Branch should not pursue policies that disadvantage the hiring of U.S. citizens and those lawfully present in the United States by making it economically advantageous to hire workers who came to the country illegally.
amendments.latest_major_action: On agreeing to the Salmon amendment (A004) Agreed to by recorded vote: 253 - 171 (Roll no. 32).

amendments.title: An amendment numbered 3 printed in Part B of House Report 114-2 to require that DHS treat any alien convicted of any offense involving domestic violence, sexual abuse, child molestation, or child abuse or exploitation as within the categories of aliens subject to DHS's highest civil immigration enforcement.
amendments.latest_major_action: On agreeing to the DeSantis amendment (A003) Agreed to by recorded vote: 278 - 149 (Roll no. 31).

amendments.title: An amendment numbered 2 printed in Part B of House Report 114-2 to provide that no funds may be used to consider new, renewal or previously denied DACA applications.
amendments.latest_major_action: On agreeing to the Blackburn amendment (A002) Agreed to by recorded vote: 218 - 209 (Roll no. 30).

amendments.title: An amendment numbered 1 printed in Part B of House Report 114-2 to prevent any funds from whatever source to be used to carry-out (1) the Executive actions announced on November 20, 2014 to grant deferred action to certain unlawful aliens and for other purposes, and (2) four of the `Morton Memos' on prosecutorial discretion and immigration enforcement priorities issued in 2011 and 2012 that effectively prevent certain classes of unlawful aliens from being removed from the country. 2) Declares that no funds may be used to carry-out any substantially similar policies to those defunded. 3) Declares that the policies defunded and any substantially similar policies have no statutory or constitutional basis and therefore no legal effect. 4) Provides that no funds may be used to grant any Federal benefit to any alien as a result of the policies defunded.
amendments.latest_major_action: On agreeing to the Aderholt amendment (A001) Agreed to by recorded vote: 237 - 190 (Roll no. 29).
